pull.title: Correct spelling and grammar improvements
pull.body:
1. **Spelling Corrections**:

  - `useable` â†’ `usable` (Correct spelling of the word)
   - `expensive_calulation` â†’ `expensive_calculation` (The word "calulation" is incorrectly spelled, and the correct spelling is "calculation" from the verb "to calculate")

2. **Grammar Improvement**:

- `be at conflict` â†’ `be in conflict` (The preposition "at" is replaced with "in" because the correct expression is "to be in conflict with," which always uses the preposition "in")

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31517.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [jonatack](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31517#pullrequestreview-2508818454) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

ACK, modulo:

- unnecessary change per https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31517/files#r1888478161
- please squash your commits as described in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits
- preferably add the `doc: ` prefix to the PR title

Thanks for your interest in contributing! However, as we have hundreds of pull requests, I am closing this to focus review on the others. (See [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#refactoring)).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,7 +71,7 @@ It is not necessary to build wallet functionality to run `bitcoind` or  `bitcoin
 
 `sqlite` is required to support for descriptor wallets.
 
-macOS ships with a useable `sqlite` package, meaning you don't need to
+macOS ships with a usable `sqlite` package, meaning you don't need to

@@ -71,7 +71,7 @@ It is not necessary to build wallet functionality to run `bitcoind` or  `bitcoin
 
 `sqlite` is required to support for descriptor wallets.
 
-macOS ships with a useable `sqlite` package, meaning you don't need to
+macOS ships with a usable `sqlite` package, meaning you don't need to
comments.body: yes, "usable" is more common in the US and "useable" more common in the UK -- either one is fine
Both "at conflict with" and "in conflict with" are grammatically correct.
